title: First Equation
text: We know the first equation represents a horizontal line whose y-intercept is 6: $$y=6$$.\n##figure1.gif##

title: Graph using intercepts
text: We will find the x- and y-intercepts of the second equation to graph it.

title: x-intercept for first equation
text: To find the x-intercept, let $$x=0$$ and solve for y: \\n $$2x+3y=12$$ \\n $$2\times0+3y=12$$ \\n $$3y=12$$ \\n $$y=4$$

title: y-intercept for first equation
text: To find the y-intercept, let $$y=0$$ and solve for x: \\n $$2x+3y=12$$ \\n $$2x+3\times0=12$$ \\n $$2x=12$$ \\n $$x=6$$

title: Intercepts for first equation
text: For equation $$x+y=2$$, plot points (0,4) and (6,0) and connect the lines.

title: Determine the point of intersection.
text: The lines intersect at (-3,6). Therefore the solution is (-3,6).
